tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE nano_material_stability (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  material_name TEXT,
  stability_condition TEXT,
  temperature FLOAT,
  humidity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE MaterialStability (
  material_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  material_name VARCHAR(255),
  stability_condition VARCHAR(255),
  temperature FLOAT,
  pressure FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE QualityControl (
  qc_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  material_id INT,
  test_date DATE,
  test_result VARCHAR(50),
  FOREIGN KEY (material_id) REFERENCES MaterialStability(material_id)
)

CREATE TABLE stability_conditions (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    material_name TEXT,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    pressure FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE stability_data (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    experiment_id INT,
    stability_score FLOAT,
    comments TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (experiment_id) REFERENCES stability_conditions(id)
);

CREATE TABLE quality_control (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    experiment_id INT,
    pass BOOLEAN,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (experiment_id) REFERENCES stability_conditions(id)
);

CREATE TABLE QualityControl (
  control_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  material_id INT,
  condition_id INT,
  control_date DATE,
  control_passed BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE NanoMaterials (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    material_name TEXT,
    stability_condition TEXT,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE StabilityTests (
    test_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    material_id INT,
    test_date DATE,
    test_result TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (material_id) REFERENCES NanoMaterials(id)
);

CREATE TABLE QCReports (
    report_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    report_date DATE,
    material_id INT,
    test_id INT,
    comment TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (material_id) REFERENCES NanoMaterials(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (test_id) REFERENCES StabilityTests(test_id)
);
